user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UT_Stub_CopyToLocal:
```c
size_t UT_Stub_CopyToLocal(UT_EntryKey_t FuncKey, void *LocalBuffer, size_t MaxSize)
{
    size_t               ActualCopy;
    UT_StubTableEntry_t *StubPtr;

    ActualCopy = 0;
    StubPtr    = UT_GetStubEntry(FuncKey, UT_ENTRYTYPE_DATA_BUFFER);

    if (StubPtr != NULL)
    {
        ActualCopy = StubPtr->Data.Buff.TotalSize - StubPtr->Data.Buff.Position;
        if (MaxSize < ActualCopy)
        {
            ActualCopy = MaxSize;
        }

        memcpy(LocalBuffer, &StubPtr->Data.Buff.BasePtr[StubPtr->Data.Buff.Position], ActualCopy);
        StubPtr->Data.Buff.Position += ActualCopy;

        /*
         * Once the buffer is completely copied then drop this entry.
         * The test harness will either refill it or there might be
         * another entry in the table.
         */
        if (StubPtr->Data.Buff.Position >= StubPtr->Data.Buff.TotalSize)
        {
            UT_ClearStubEntry(StubPtr);
        }
    }

    return ActualCopy;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags: size_t UT_Stub_CopyToLocal(UT_EntryKey_t FuncKey, void *LocalBuffer, size_t MaxSize)
explanation: The MISRA C Rule 8.13 concerns whether pointer types could be const-qualified. The remaining fragments in the function are either non-pointer objects (ActualCopy, MaxSize), control-flow statements (if checks, return), or operations that modify the data structure (e.g. incrementing Position, calling UT_ClearStubEntry). Those are not candidates for adding const (they are scalar variables or require mutability), so they do not need to be investigated for this rule. Additionally, calls to helper functions (UT_GetStubEntry, UT_ClearStubEntry) are external and would be checked in their own definitions if needed; their usage here does not itself indicate a missing const qualification in local declarations.
